children: Meningiomas are usually benign in histology and behavior. These tumors are usually discovered incidentally during neuroimaging for unrelated symptoms. Symptomatic patients typically have progressive headache and focal neurologic lesions. CT scan of the head will show a homogeneously enhancing extra-axial mass adherent to the dura and an enhancing dural “tail.”
Surgical resection is the treatment of choice for symptomatic meningiomas or enlarging meningiomas. Observation is appropriate for small, asymptomatic meningiomas.
Chemotherapy has no established role in patients with meningioma.
